definition[0]: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining
example[1]: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
definition[1]: to make an idea or feeling stop
definition[2]: to remove someone’s permission or right to do something
example[3]: Any settlement extinguishes the plaintiff’s title to that interest in the goods.
example[4]: The contract would be valid only where such rights had not been extinguished by the government.
definition[3]: to agree that a debt does not have to be paid
example[5]: Death does not automatically extinguish debts on bank accounts.
